answers.question: What financial assistance is available for Ukrainians in Romania?
answers.answer: Ukrainians in Romania may be eligible for a monthly lump sum to cover accommodation expenses for up to 3 consecutive months. After this period, or for those who previously received benefits, they may apply for a Minimum Inclusion Income. Additionally, refugees under temporary protection are eligible for other social benefits.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.
answers.read_instruction: read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.

answers.question: How does one apply for this support?
answers.answer: To apply for the lump sum, beneficiaries need to submit their application to the local administrative-territorial unit where they have chosen to reside. They must fill in the application form, provide personal details including CNP numbers, attach proof of temporary protection, provide a bank account statement, and indicate they are not residing in a temporary accommodation camp.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Application Process'.

answers.question: When did the new support program start?
answers.answer: The new financial support program dedicated to Ukrainians living in Romania started as of July 1, 2024. This change is outlined in Government Emergency Ordinance No. 96/2024.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the page carefully.

answers.question: How long can people receive accommodation payments?
answers.answer: Beneficiaries of temporary protection in Romania may be eligible for a monthly lump sum to cover accommodation expenses for up to 3 consecutive months. This 3-month period starts from the date of entry into Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.
answers.read_instruction: read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.
